1.content:
Skye fidgeted in her seat as she waited for her late husband's lawyer to come in and read his last will and testament. Fat lot of good it would do, she'd already found out that he owed an anormous amount of taxes and she was being evicted from her beautiful home, having to sell her dog grooming business and all of her lovely french furniture. If she could just get her hands on his neck! May he rot in Hades!

Mr. Baxter came in and sat straight in his chair, folding his large hands around a bundle of paper.

"I know we have already read the main will, but there is a special clause in it that I was instructed to read to you after you had a little time to grieve for Mr. Phillips."

She was fuming and cursing Ryan under her breath and told the lawyer to just get to it.

"Mrs. Phillips, your late husband has left you something that was very near and dear to his heart and the only thing the state cannot take away from you", he squirmed in his seat, "Who'd want it anyway", he said in a low voice.

"What? I couldn't hear you." She leaned forward so she might hear him better.
1.title: Last Will and Testament

11.content:
"What? I couldn't hear you." She leaned closer so she might hear him better.

He cleared his throat and began, "This wonderful old hotel on a beautiful hawaiian island. Mr. Phillips told me many wonderful stories of his grandparents running it and he said he stayed there every summer until he went off to college."

He handed her a picture of the most run down dump she'd ever laid her eyes on! It was a three story building with the shutters hanging at odd angles, paint peeling off in large ribbons and thousands of palm fronds scattered everywhere. Surely there had been a hurricane or some natural disaster for it to look like that.

The place was not even habitable and yet it was to be her only home. She stomped her feet and began to cry. A good tantrum always made her feel better. She composed herself, thanked the lawyer and went back to her last night in a hotel room, they would toss her in the streets tommorow.

She smeared cold cream on her face and was grateful the old hotel had also come with the plane fare to get there. She looked at her green face in the mirror.

"You think you've gotten the best of me Ryan Phillips? I'll make that place the best hotel in Hauo, Huoo.....oh whatever it is!"
11.title: A nice hotel...for rats

111.content:
"Would you like something to drink?", the flight attendant asked her.

She looked up from the magazine she'd been flipping through and politely declined the beverage. Fifi stuck her polished nail through the mesh screen of the pet carrier. Skye reassured her that everything was ok and the poodle laid down and went back to sleep.

Skye laid her head on the back of the scratchy airline seat and closed her eyes. She wished she was already there so she could access the situation and reassure herself she wouldn't be living on the beach clad in rags and searching for crabs so she wouldn't starve to death.

"Skye.", someone whispered in her ear.

Her eyes flew open and she turned to see who was there. No one was there. She sat there stiff. It had sounded so much like Ryan, when he was in one of his playful moods. He had chased her through the house sometimes, spitting chocolate milk on her or trying to catch her for a kiss. She smiled at a good memory and then remembered he had also cheated on her. Her eyes got misty and she leaned back and closed them again and told herself not to start conjuring up ghosts. The condemmed property that Ryan had left her would keep her busy for a long time to come.
111.title: Ghosts fly too

choices: a flock of birds hit the engines
1111.content:
When they landed in Oahu, she had instructions to meet a man named Koko and he would take her to the hotel. She picked up Fifi's carrier and set out to look for him.He was holding a cardboard sign with her name on it. He retrieved her luggage and she followed him, not to a waiting vehicle but out onto the flight field.

"Koko, where are we going?", she asked loudly and holding onto her hat. Planes and jets buzzed past them as she ran to keep up.

"We have to take another plane to get to the hotel.", he explained.

"What?", she yelled, "I don't understand. I was told the hotel was on this island." She grabbed at her skirt as it tried to fly over her head, then her hat again, nearly dropping poor Fifi.

"No, we have to take this plane to the island. Very secluded, you will like it very much." He started throwing luggage into the back compartment of the small plane.

"Mary Mother of God, please be with me!", she said and made the sign of the cross. Even if she wasn't of that faith, it couldn't hurt.

She climbed in, throwing her hat on the luggage pile and the dog carrier on her lap. Koko got the engines revved up as it spat out huge clouds of black smoke. As they started down the runway, she clutched the bar on the door until her knuckles were white. They heard a thump, thump noise and Koko jumped out and put some tire sealant in a tire and hopped back in. What would happen if the tire were flat again when they landed, she grimaced?
1111.title: Extended trip

choices: the day is young yet, perhaps a view of the town?
11111.content:
Skye tryed talking to Koko, but it was no use over the loud engine. She did find out that he was married to a girl named Kimmy and had two children.

The plane suddenly lurched forward and started to nosedive. She grabbed the dashboard, the dog carrier still in her lap. She looked at Koko with terrified eyes and he told her it happened all the time, as he twisted this knob and turned that handle. She was not reassured and looked at the ocean below, putting her hands over her eyes.

All of a sudden, it felt like some force yanked her hands away from her eyes and she saw the water looming closer and closer. She screamed and Fifi started yelping as Koko righted the plane right before impact. She however, had fainted dead away.

She felt someone shaking her and Koko was telling her they had landed. Thank God! She must have passed out and was spared the landing, leaving it a mystery of whether they landed on one wheel.

Koko took her hand to help her out of the plane and she hooked her heel on the door and pitched forward on top of him. She told him she was sorry and rolled off him and collected the dog carrier. She straightened her clothes and waited while he gathered the luggage. She felt as if she'd been dragged behind one of the chariots in The Gladiator.
11111.title: One disaster after another

111111.content:
Skye followed Koko to a small shack where a man was selling snowcones. "I'll have one of those please. Koko find me a cab, will you?" She dug in her purse for some change and selected a cherry cone.

"No cab Mrs. Phillips. I have my car." He sat her luggage down and went to get his car.

She nibbled on the delicious, cold treat and let Fifi have a few nibbles too. The man in the snowcone shack chuckled to himself and hid behind a newspaper. She would probably laugh at the site of herself too. She heard an awful noise to see Koko driving a beat up army jeep, spitting and sputtering, threatening to die any minute. He helped her in the seat and hurried and jumped in himself before it died.

She wondered why everything here was so old and wornout? Was this place so isolated that they were far behind in modern things? She was used to modern facilities, what if they had only outside bathrooms?

She finally had to put the dog carrier in the back seat so she could hang onto her hat and dress at the same time. Miracles upon miracles, there was a seatbelt around her waist, keeping her body from flying away. They were zooming around mountain roads without any guardrails, she just knew any minute they would fly off a cliff and into the sea.
111111.title: Tropical Privy?

choices: she hears an odd voice in the wall
1111111.content:
They turned down a long, winding road and she saw the building from the picture, as they drove up the circular drive. They bumped along as they drove over the many palm fronds littering the drive. They came to a stop and Koko turned off the ignition but the old jeep kept clanking and spitting smoke and finally when they both gave it a hard look, it died.

Koko sat her luggage inside and told her he had to get home but he, Kimmy and the kids would be out to help her tommorow. He had worked there as a teenager and could show her where things were. She told him thanks and watched him drive away through the rusted screendoor.

She looked around at all the sheets draped over the furniture and decided she had to find a place to sleep before she dropped in her tracks. She let Fifi out of the carrier and outside for a few minutes. Back inside as she headed up the stairs, the knob came off in her hand.

"Mental note, fix the stairway knob.", she said wearily.

She tossed the knob over her shoulder with a thud and headed up the stairs. The stairs creaked and she thought something was behind her, but when she turned to look, the knob was back in place. She was more tired and stressed than she had thought. She scooted up the stairs to find a place to sleep.
1111111.title: Home sweet home?

choices: Skye's foot slips off the edge of the cliff
11111111.content:
Skye awoke on a matress on the floor with one of the dirty dust covers and Fifi on top of her. She sat up fuzzy about where she was and then remembered the awful day before. She saw the bedframe leaning against a wall, along with an old mirror, and gasped at the sight of herself in it. Her one hundred dollar hairdo was ruined. She looked like a fighting rooster that had lost the fight! She grabbed clean clothes and her jumbo makeup bag and set out to find the nearest bathroom.

She found the bathroom just across the hall. There was no shower and the pipes in the bathtub clanged and groaned and finally spat out some water. She took a lukewarm bath, not lingering any longer than necessary.

She dabbed her makeup on just right and curiously opened the medicine cabinet for a peek. She was surprised to see not the inside of the cabinet but the outside through the wall. There was a dove resting in a tree outside that didn't seem alarmed by her nosiness. She stared at the bird for a minute and saw Koko and his family below clearing the palm fronds. She excused herself from the bird and went downstairs.

She called Fifi to go outside and talk to Koko and his family. When she got to the screendoor, no one was out front. She went to the back and saw Koko at the edge of the back yard putting the fronds in a pile to burn. She picked Fifi up and they walked towards him between some patio tables and chairs, and was about to say something when she fell into a huge hole in the ground. Fifi went flying into the air when they landed in the dirt.

"Are you ok Mrs.Phillips?", Koko asked.

She spat dirt out of her mouth and sat up. So much for clean clothes and makeup around here, she thought. Koko jumped in and helped her out.

"Koko, why is that huge hole there?"

"Ahh, that is for the pig roasts they used to have here, big luau. They put hot rocks in there and wrap the pig in banana leaves and slow cook all day. Good eating."

"Well please put some boards over it before someone gets killed!"
11111111.title: First day in Paradise

choices: take a nice walk, and get lost!
111111111.content:
"Well please put some boards over it before someone gets killed."

She walked to the edge and looked at the ocean below. There were several steps leading down to the beach and she decided to go check it out. Fifi bounced down the steps behind her.

At the bottom, she kicked off her shoes and let the sand warm the bottom of her feet. She walked up to the waves lapping the shore and waded in. She saw a large wave coming in and tryed to back up to the shoreline away from it. She wasn't fast enough and the wave knocked her down into the foamy surf.

Some slimy black thing grabbed her around the waist and she screamed and flailed her arms. She wriggled loose and ran and picked up one of her heels for a weapon. She stood her ground as the thing stood up, water dripping from it. It was a man in a diver's suit.

"Sorry if I frightened you mate, I didn't want you to drown." He held his diver's mask and slicked the water from his hair, smiling at her.

"How dare you scare me like that! Just because I'm female, you think you have to rescue me? I may be new around here, but I will not be the butt of your stupid jokes!" She put her shoes on and called Fifi to follow her back up the stairs. If he thought she was impressed by his good looks, she'd fallen for that before and look where it had gotten her.

She did, however like his australian accent, she admitted to herself, as she stomped off up the stairs.

He stood with a puzzled look on his face. Women...he thought and shook his head.
111111111.title: Creature from the Blue Lagoon

choices: no one said there was a volcano
1111111111.content:
Skye stomped up the stairs and was headed for the backdoor wen she turned to look for Fifi. The crazy dog was dancing around on her hind feet like she used to do for Ryan, when he teased her with boiled chicken, her favorite. Fifi stopped dancing and sat looking at something and wagging her stumpy tail. It had been too much for the dog as well as her, she'd have to see if there was a good therapist around for the both of them.

She called to the dog and set off towards a bungalow to the left of the hotel, just off the driveway. She walked over and stuck her head inside. Kimmy was humming loudly to herself as she worked.

"Ahh, Ms. Phillips, so glad to met you. I'm Kimmy."

She stuck out her hand and Skye shook it and was nearly knocked down by two dark haired whirlwinds that stopped long enough to kneal down and pet Fifi.

"I'm sorry, these two belong to me. Is it okay if they play with the dog?"

"Yes, it's fine. Fifi, go play with the children."

She gave the dog a hand signal to go outside and the children followed. She closed the screendoor and turned to look around.

"I've been getting it ready for you. I hope you like it", the dark haired beauty looked at her for approval.

"Tell me Kimmy, does it have a shower with hot water?"

"Yes, it does, right through there."

"Then I love it. Thanks." She excused herself and went to talk to Koko who was still gathering fronds.

"Koko, I need to go to town and hire some more people, some ladies to clean, a good carpenter and painter...I've never done this kind of work before. Of course I will supervise all operations."

"Yes, Ms. Phillips. I'll go tell Kimmy we're running into town."

She went to get her purse and shuttered at the thought of riding in that green deathtrap of Koko's. She called to Fifi and they got into the jeep as Koko hugged the kids and promised to bring them a treat from town. He hopped in and cranked the puffing dragon to life. She'd learned to wear pants for this trip and no hat. The heck with her hair, it was totally hopeless.
1111111111.title: Day One: Hiring more help

11111111111.content:
They call this a town, she thought? They had driven about ten miles and pulled up in front of the grocery store. It looked like it was out of the fifties, still sporting an ad for Nehi cola, on a faded out, old screen door. She checked her footing as she stepped up on the porch running the length of the building. There were several tiny houses scattered around the hillsides. Small children began to gather, eating snowcones, the colored syrup dripping down their chins and clothing. She held Fifi out of reach of their sticky fingers as she passed.

She learned from the store keeper that there was also a hardware store that only recieved a shipment once a month, hopefully he had a good supply of lumber, nails and paint. There was also a man that rented mopeds, heaven knows who'd be crazy enough to ride one of those things, those mountain roads were bad enough in Koko's car.

Finally there was a small school, gas station, bakery, bank and post office, which also held a small library. Her grooming business had been almost as big as this whole town!

Koko let her explore while he went about finding people to employ. She spyed another jeep and it was for sale, problem was it was a godawful pepto bismol pink. She really needed her own vehicle, she couldn't grab Koko everytime she needed to go somewhere.

Koko returned with news of hiring three more women and two men. One of the men was an excellent carpenter and would be out this afternoon to talk to her. She mentioned the jeep and he said it was the only vehicle in town that was for sale. Against her better judgement, she bought it.
11111111111.title: Pink is for girls

111111111111.content:
When they got back, she was glad the jeep had made it. The new help was arriving by cars and donkeys and she had to get everything organized and get each person a specific job to do. She went into the kitchen and grabbed a sandwich that Kimmy had made her. Thank goodness someone had their head on straight, she'd been so preoccupied with seeing the town and the car and all, now she'd have to make another trip to town for groceries.

Everyone was given their assignments and it was time for her to relax a bit.She went out on the back porch and stretched out in a hammock and closed her eyes.

"I'm here for a job interview.",came a voice from below the porch.

She sat up and lowered her sunglasses, peering above them. She recognized the accent, it was the guy on the beach that had humiliated her.

"Oh, I'm sorry, all positions have been filled. Run along and play in your frog suit."

She raised her glasses back into place and layed back down. Koko came around the corner of the house.

"I see you have met our carpenter.", Koko said, shaking hands with the man.

She bolted upright, taking off her glasses and looking at Koko like he'd gone mad.

"This is Quinn Reeves, the best carpenter on the island." Koko patted Quinn's shoulder and excused himself to have lunch with his wife.

"Mrs. phillips is it? How ya goin? Listen, I'm sorry about the thing at the beach this mornin, I really was tryin to help." He stood with his arms crossed and smiled at her.

"Yes well, I'd like to forget about that incident and it's Ms. Phillips. I'm a recent widow, my late husband left me this wonderful, old hotel and I'd like to get it fixed up and running, hopefully before tourist season begins.

"Get it done in eight weeks? That's impossible! I mean this place needs alot o work."

"Then might I suggest you get started, Mr. Reeves."

She left him standing in the yard, watching the screen door slam behind her.
111111111111.title: The impossible job

1111111111111.content:
He scratched his head a moment and called to her. She stepped outside the screen door and looked at him.

"Mr. Reeves, I realize it's alot of work, but I truly believe it can be done. Please help me, I've never had to do anything like this before."

"Alright, I'll try, no promises. And you can call me Quinn. I'll be back in the mornin to start replacin those rotten boards." He walked past her new car.

"I see Joe found a new owner for old Pepto.", he laughed and walked to his beatup moped.

"And I see there is someone crazy enough to ride one of those things!", she called to him and actually found herself smiling.

She opened the screen door and a loose board flew up and slapped her on the rear. Mental note she said to her self tiredly, fix the loose board. She held the screen door so it wouldn't slam and watched it slowly fall forward onto the porch in a small cloud of dust.

Her workers were waiting outside for her to dismiss them and they tried to surpress their laughter but a few snickers escaped.

"Thank you all for a good days work. I will see you in the morning."

So happy I could keep you all amused, she thought to herself, as she shut the inside door to keep out the bugs. She grabbed some peanut butter and crackers she supposed Kimmy had made for the children and headed for her bungalow for some much needed rest.
1111111111111.title: Second night in paradise

choices: see the children with something odd
11111111111111.content:
Skye awoke to a pounding outside and looked at the clock, six o'clock! No one got up that early, did they? She looked at Fifi and the dog buried back under the covers, also upset over the noise outside. She looked out and saw Quinn carrying lumber towards the bugalow. Lordy, she couldn't let him see her looking like a shipwreck, she needed a shower and her makeup.

She was standing in the warm spray, when a board was ripped off the wall right next to her and she saw Quinn's shocked face. She grabbed for the shower curtain gathering it around her. He said he was sorry, with a slight smirk on his face and put the board back into place. She quickly dried off and put on her satin blouse, capri pants and heeled sandals. She put on her makeup quickly, some was better than none. She grabbed her purse and the dog, yelling at Koko to keep everyone busy and that she was going to get groceries. She saw Quinn standing on the ladder looking at her as she left and he tipped his hat, with that smirky grin on his face.

She was unpacking the groceries when Quinn came in, washed the sweat off his face in the sink, drying off with a dishtowel and grabbed a beer from the fridge.

"I see you brought your own lunch.", she said sarcastically, as he popped the lid off on the edge of the table.

She left some snacks and things in the bag for the bungalow, having no desire to go out in the darkness if she got hungry.

"I coulda used some popcorn for the show earlier.". He leaned against the fridge, smiling at her and taking a noisy guzzle of beer.

"Believe you me, you will not get that opportunity again!" She grabbed her grocery bag and headed for the bungalow to cool off. Why did that man get under her skin like he did?
11111111111111.title: What's the movie tonight?

111111111111111.content:
Skye avoided Quinn for the next couple of days, keeping the ladies busy on the inside of the hotel. Things were going great until the workers started to get spooked about things dissapearing and now they claimed that things were floating in midair. The dog was possesed, dancing around and chasing something that was invisible to the human eye. Anna, the one she trusted most and who kept all the younger workers in line, was claiming to have seen the children's glasses of chocolate milk just float away. Chocolate milk had been Ryan's favorite....but he was gone, wasn't he?

Of course he was, she was there at the funeral and had said goodbye to him. She refused to crack up like her crazy canine and tried to reassure everyone but they were not having any part of a ghost and left saying they would not return.

She sat on the porch steps watching them all leave down the long driveway. What in the heck would she do now? She had to get this place up and running so she could unload it on some other sucker and get back to the city where she belonged.

Quinn, Koko, Kimmy, Fifi and the kids sat down by her on the porch and told her they would not abandon her even if the old hotel were haunted, no ghost could run them off.
111111111111111.title: Going, going, gone

1111111111111111.content:
"I don't know how we can pull this off but we just have to work harder. Thank you all for staying."

She stood up and headed for the bungalow, feeling a monster size headache coming on. She swallowed some pills and lay down with her stress reliever mask on and tried to relax. Fifi was beside her and she felt the dog's tail wagging.

"One of those awful headaches Skye?"

"Yes, it's been one of those days."

She realized it was Ryan's voice and shot straight up in bed, yanking the mask from her eyes.

He was sitting on the dresser, his feet crossed at the ankles, swinging them gently back and forth. He was twirling his fingers so Fifi, standing on her hind legs, was dancing in circles.

She fell backwards and put her pillow over her face and stifled a scream. Now I'm hallucinating, she thought and lowered the pillow to find him still there.

"My darling Skye, I assure you I'm really here and not a figment of your imagination." He jumped down from the dresser and sat beside her on the bed. He was there and yet he was translucent looking.

"Why...Why...are you here?", she croaked, her voice cracking, the thought of him haunting her was absurd. She leaned closer and poked at him, uneasy yet curious.

"My pet, you know this was my favorite childhood place, what better place to haunt?"

"Ryan, you screw up everything. Why didn't you cross over, you know go to the light or something?" She threw her hands into the air in frustration, she wanted him to just go.

"I don't know Skye...I think it was you, I can't go until I help you do something, though I'm not sure what. They didn't give me a manual on death you know."

"Well now you've run off all my help around here and the hotel probably won't be ready to open in time. Your dumb pranks have possibly ruined my chance at making a go at this. You made me miserable in life and now the same goes in death! Please go away and leave me with some of my sanity." She flung herself down on the bed and cryed.

Ryan clucked his tongue and tryed to comfort her but she wailed and slapped in his direction.

"I'm sorry pet, I wish I could go but I can't until this thing is resolved. I will leave you for now. Come Fifi." He vanished through the door, then the door opened for Fifi and she ran outside.

She stopped crying and wiped her eyes. This is not a good time for a ghost, she said to herself, especially my ex husband's ghost.
1111111111111111.title: When is a good time for a ghost?

11111111111111111.content:
Skye's crying jag was over and now she was just plain mad. Mad at how Ryan had treated her, mad at the possibility of having to live here in this dumpy hotel for the rest of her days, mad not knowing that she could have actually have pulled this off and had a showplace in which to sell. She stomped outside and let the screen door slam behind her, heading for the kitchen door, mumbling to herself.

"Why must that man make my life a living hell?"

She walked past Quinn without noticing him. He stood up and walked quickly to catch up with her.

"Uh Skye...Ms. Phillips, maybe we got off on the wrong foot and I apologize if I got outa line."

She spun on her heel to face him and laughed, almost hysterically and saw the concern in his eyes.

"Oh, you thought I was talking about you. No, no....I was talking about the late Mr. Phillips. Seems he really is a ghost and he's haunting the hotel and me for some reason. I just saw him right over there in the bugalow." She pointed behind her and continued walking to the kitchen. He scooted ahead of her and opened the door as she walked in and sat down at the table as if she were in a trance.

He grabbed two beers from the fridge, popped off the lids and handed her one. She turned the bottle up and drank it in three big swigs. She started to get up for another one.

"Whoa.", he said pushing her shoulders, back into the chair. "You will really have a nasty headache if you don't slow down." He tore open a package of chips and put them before her and she munched on them and looked towards the back door. He was starting to wonder when the fog was gonna lift when she jumped from her chair and stood looking out the screen door.

"Quinn look. You see that dumb dog? He's right there, making her do all those silly tricks. He taught them to her, bribed her with boiled chicken."

"He's out there, right now, making the dog do tricks?" Normally he would think she'd gone mad but the aborigines had taught him that spirits were everywhere, whether we could see them or not.

"Are you blind, he's right there?" She paused for a minute. "Of course you can't. Only the the one being haunted can see the ghost."

Quinn took off his hat and ran his fingers through his dark hair, curled by sweat. "Okay, let's figure this out. He's probably not here to haunt you, he's here to see his beloved hotel restored and as soon as that's done, he'll go where ever it is he's supposed to go."

"Does that mean you believe me, that he's really here?" She looked at him relieved.

"That or your silly dog needs a good shrink."

They both looked outside at the dog and laughed.
11111111111111111.title: Fifi the dancing dog

111111111111111111.content:
Skye managed to get half a good night's sleep, the other half waiting for Ryan's ghost to pop in and torture her some more. Thank goodness he waited till morning before he disturbed her.

She felt a slight tickling at her nose and kept swatting at it. She then heard Fifi bark and knew who the intruder was. She threw the pillow over her head and told him to go away. Of course he had no intentions of doing that, so she sat up and glared at him.

"Good morning Sweetheart, how did you sleep?", he asked as he sat on the dresser, one knee up, his right elbow on it, the other hand telling the poodle to sit and behave.

"Better than I ever slept with you!", she spat at him, trying to get the dog over to her side and betray her master.

"Ouch, that really hurts. I did love you once, didn't you love me?", he asked pouting his lips.

"Yes, me and every woman at the country club! Now get out, I have to get dressed and get to work. The sooner I get this hotel done, the sooner I'll be rid of you!"

"You don't mean you're actually thinking of doing manual labor? You've never had to work in you're life, why you're totally helpless.", he said as a pillow sailed right through him, knocking over some perfume bottles.

"Well there's a first time for everything and I don't think Quinn will mind showing me what to do." She rummaged through the closet for appropriate work clothes.

"Ah ,yes the aussie carpenter, quite roggish isn't he?"

"How should I know, he's just here to help me get the job done. I'm done with men, It's time I thought about me and my future and right now this hotel is my future." She grabbed a pair of khaki pants, fresh from the cleaners ,and a pale blue satin blouse and headed for the bathroom, slamming the door.
111111111111111111.title: It's too early for spooks

choices: go dig a hole and find burried treasure
1111111111111111111.content:
The man made her so furious. How come he had to bug her. Why not one of the many women he had cheated on her with.

That made more sense.

Walking outside after her shower she saw Quinn replacing the loose board that had hit her in the rump.

"Thank you so much Quinn." Skye said as she walked over to him.

"No problem Ms.Phillips. Saw the show the other day and thought to fix this so your bum don't get hurt any more."

"Well yes, that's why I'm thanking you. Um, do you need any help. Just tell me what to do and I'll do it."
1111111111111111111.title: No more Rump Board

Dam it she thought .What in the world could the ghost of that man want from me.Hello?Hello
It was the handyman Quinn,'lady are you all right"
Why of course I am .Fifi"Where are you ?FiFi?
Sky called ignoring Quinn.As I was saying miss..

course they are Quinn.Do you want my help?No mam

at the door .Sky noticed him before the workers.
"Oh god not now", she thought, It was the lawyer
managing this dump.
Well come in,FiFi began to jump on his leg .
"Oh"no not Ryan."Ryan Why Now"?
"Hello would you like some lemonade"?
"FiFi"fiFi stop!Sky picked up FiFi and took her to an empty room and shut the door.
I just stopped by.To see how you were doing I have some papers to Uh.As the lawyer said that FiFi happened to be in the room again and was relieving himself on the lawyers leg.
I am so sorry said Sky as the lawyer severly composed walked out the front door ,all the while going I understand ,I understand,Mabe you can come by the office,as the screen door slammed.
Sky looked around the room FiFi was nowhere to be seen.She walked to the room she put him in.
The door was still closed .Confused she slowly
opened the door.FiFi?He was laying on some old blankets in the corner of the room just waking from a sound sleep.Sky shut the door."RYAN,RYan.
"Why are you doing this to me?"
11111111111111111111.title: Til Death Do Us Part?

111111111111111111111.content:
Skye woke up to the sound of the bell ringing, she was back in the hotel. The woman hurriedly made her way downstairs.
"Oh hi Skye!" a potential customer called. He was a heavily built man, with wrinkles and long black hair, he spoke in strange, accented english.
"Are you here for a room, because..." Skye began, but the man cut her off.
"Ha ha ha. That is a funny story, but tell me, do you want to play some football?" He asked.
111111111111111111111.title: Oh hi Skye!

1111111111111111112.content:
Skye grabbed a pair of khaki pants and a pale blue silk shirt from the closet and padded to the bathroom and slammed the door. Thankfully when she came out, he was gone. She strapped on her italian sandals and headed for the hotel kitchen.

She grabbed a cup of coffee and placed a paper towel on the top porch step and sat down. The steaming brew helped calm her frazzled nerves. Quinn, looking bright eyed and bushy tailed, crossed the yard and sat down beside her.

"So, how's things this fine morning?"

He held his cup in his big, rough, hands and stared out at the ocean view, beyond the cliffs.

"Fine, until I had to deal with Ryan this morning. He is a pompous jackass. He thinks I can't do manual labor! That's just not true, I can. Quinn, will you help me prove him wrong, show me how to do some sawing or hammering or something? I have to get this place in shape and sell it to have some money to live on. I'm so afraid of being poor."

"Being poor is not that bad, I live outa my toolbox mostly."

"Oh, I didn't mean to insinuate anything about poor people", she stammered an apology. She lowered her voice. "Please help me get rid of him", she nodded towards the swing in the yard, gliding along by itself.

"I reckon that's reason enough. I think we'll start you out on some painting."
1111111111111111112.title: Show me the ways of the saw

choices: maybe she should just read a good book
11111111111111111121.content:
"I reckon that's reason enough. I think I'll start you out on some painting."

Quinn stood up and Skye followed him to the sitting area in front of the hotel. He scratched at his chin as he looked at her clothes and found her a pair of coveralls to put on. Since they were quite large, they had to roll up the sleeves and pant legs several times. He handed her a paint brush, roller and poured some paint in the tray. He gave her a few minutes of instruction and left her on her own.

A while later, Koko walked by the sitting room and glancing out of the corner of his eye, shook his head sadly and walked out the front door. He'd never seen anyone paint a room like that before.

Skye had actually been doing quite well, that is until Ryan had wanted to help. First they had fought over the paint brush, with her coveralls, face and hair, streaked with wet, sticky paint. She had seen Koko walk by but was too busy in her power struggle with Ryan to say anything to him. She finally let Ryan have the brush and she picked up the roller, trying to smooth out the paint already on the wall. Ryan decided he wanted the roller too and it flew out of her hands. He made a giant tic tac toe game on the wall that infuriated her and she grabbed the tray and flung it towards him just as Quinn came into the room. He walked towards the mess in disbelief.

"Maybe paintin's just not you're thing."
11111111111111111121.title: Monkey see-monkey do

choices: Skye walkes in and tries to help Quinn
111111111111111111211.content:
"I can paint," Skye said, "It's just my dead husband wants to paint too and I would rather see him leave me ALONE!" Skye screamed as she walked away from her wall.

Quinn whisteled as he started to clean up the mess. With all the paint in a pile Quinn went to get the mop. When he returned he saw the paint splattered all over the floor and foot prints every where. They were to big to be Skye's and Koko's family would never do something like this.

Putting in the back of his mind Quinn cleaned up the mess.
111111111111111111211.title: Cleaning Lady

choices: secret of the island is revealed
111111111111111111212.content:
Maybe she should just read a good book. She dropped to her kness and began to cry, feeling the sticky mess in her hair.

"Now we'll be havin none of that. We just have to find something you're better at."

Quinn grabbed her under her arms and lifted her up. He wiped more paint off his hands onto his jeans. He took her outside and showed her some rotten boards that had to come down so he could replace them. Surely she could work a hammer and pull out a few rusty nails. He gave her a few instructions and left her once again.

She sniffed loudly a few times and began concentrating on the task that Quinn had trusted her to do. Once again Ryan showed up and wanted to help and they fought over the hammer , swinging it wildly. She regained control but not before ther were several holes in the building and a broken window.

At the sound of breaking glass, Quinn and Koko came running. Skye stood there looking sheepishly and Quinn took the hammer from her, looking at the wall in disbelief.

"You are really starting to scare me. Are you on any kind of medication?"

"Very funny", she said, "I think it's time for lunch." She stomped away, picking at the globs of paint in her hair.

Quinn shook his head and told Koko lunch was a good idea because he needed a cold beer.
111111111111111111212.title: Unwanted helper

1111111111111111112121.content:
Kimmy made sandwiches for everyone and they sat outside to eat. It had been a trying day dealing with a dumb ghost but when Quinn laughed at the paint all in her hair she didn't get mad, she laughed right along with him. She tried to tell him all the mishaps were Ryan's fault but she gave up and ate her lunch.

They talked about everything and nothing and he had some good stories about Australia and his big family that was still there. He visited about every six months, mostly to meet his new nieces and nephews, the family growing bigger all the time. Skye listened about everyone and hung on Quinn's every word. She had no family left except Fifi, and she was a traitor!

Skye realized that the whole time they had been eating that Ryan had not come around. Maybe if she could talk Quinn in to letting her be his helper, she wouldn't have to deal with that pesky spirit for the rest of the day.
1111111111111111112121.title: A big family of Aussies

11111111111111111121211.content:
Skye followed Quinn around that afternoon, looking over her shoulder from

time to time to see if that pesky ghost was around. So far Ryan was staying away

but now she was making herself a pest. Everytime Quinn turned around, he ran into

her, once stepping on her foot and she squealed and sat down rubbing it.

"I'm sorry, but I've noticed that Ryan doesn't hang around when I'm with you and believe me I can use a break from him. I really don't mind helping you."

"Tell you what, I'm just about finished for the day, why don't we take a swim?"

"Sounds great, meet you down there shortly."
11111111111111111121211.title: Keeping the ghost at bay

111111111111111111212111.content:
Skye put on her best bathing suit, a brown one piece, with swirly, gold trim across the top and the leg openings. She put on her designer flip flops and a huge tan hat and headed down the stairs to the beach.

She could see thast Quinn was already down there and had set up a big fishing pole. Fishing? She thought they were going for a swim. She was almost to the bottom when Quinn threw back the pole, snagging her hat and tossing it into the foamy water.He turned to look at her apoligetically, laying the pole down and retrieving the soggy hat. She reached the bottom putting her fingers to her temples and counting to ten.
Breathe in, breathe out. There all better, good thing she had learned self control in these last few days because she certainly couldn't afford a shrink and she doubted one resided anywhere near anyway.

Quinn ran up to her, shaking the disgusting foam from her hat.

"There you go mate, good as new."

"Mate? What do you mean?"

"Oh, it's aussie for good friend. We are friends aren't we?"

"Of course we are, I've got lots of hats, it's no big deal."

They went for a swim and then rested on the beach, watching the pole Quinn had propped up with some driftwood. When they were ready to leave, all that was on the pole was seaweed.

"We could have some seaweed soup", Quinn teased.

"Yes, I hear it's good for your pancreas or something", she said seriously.

Quinn wrinkled up his nose and laughed.

"Wealthy folks eat some strangs things!"

He tossed the seaweed on the sand and led the way up the stairs.
111111111111111111212111.title: Seaweed soup?

1111111111111111112121111.content:
Skye and Quinn had steaks and baked potatoes hot off the grill. They ate and watched the sunset, washing down their meal with a beer. They both agreed it had been a long day and retired to their quarters. She took a long, soaking bath and decided to watch a little tv before turning in. She tuned into an animal show about orphan chimps and felt herself tearing up. She pulled Fifi closer and hugged her. All of a sudden the tv started just flipping through the channels all on it's own. She banged the remote on the nightstand and it stopped on the channel she had been watching. She relaxed and got back into the show.
The tv turned it's self off, then on, the off, then on. She beat the remote on the table again and it stopped. Again she rejoined her heartbreaking show. She felt the tears about to explode from her eyes and Ryan's face appeared, larger than life, on the tv screen. Skye screamed a bolod curdling scream and Fifi started barking. Ryan laughed at her and was gone.

Quinn ran in with a sheet wrapped around him.

"What is it?", he asked and noticed she was crying. He sat on the bed and held her hand.

"Ryan scared the bejesus out of me. He was in the tv, making it change channels and turning it off and on and off and on."

"Ok, just relax. It's all over." He made her lay back against the pile of pillows on her bed.

She sniffled and wiped her eyes on the sheet.

"It's not over, I can't get rid of him until I do what ever it is I'm supposed to do. Maybe when the hotel is done he'll go away."

"Hmm...You know theres a woman in town that can talk to spirits, maybe she can get rid of them too."

"Really? Please get her to come out as soon as she can!"

"I'll go into town first thing in the morning and see when she can come out."

"Thank you Quinn for being such a good friend."
1111111111111111112121111.title: to be continued...

choices: Stay upstairs and try to foeget about the voice
go back to the stair well and listen to the wall again
11111112.content:
"Skye."

She looked around and saw no one. "Losing my mind." she told herself.

"Skye."

She heard it again. Skye leaned into the nearest wall. Nothing.

"Skye!" He name was shouted this time. She jumped back and ran up the rest of the stairs.
11111112.title: Hello!

choices: There is someone lying in the middle of the road
Koko has broken down, and it is a long walk in either direction
1111112.content:
Koko suddenly swung the car to the left without warning. Skye breathed a sigh of relief. At least this was away from the cliff edge, so an imminent plunge meaning certain death was off the cards for the time being.

"This is a short cut," Koko told Skye. "But only take it in good weather. It is a steep climb and very narrow. It can get muddy." Skye looked out the window, wondering if this was good weather, what counted as bad in these parts? The skies were turning purple, and the wind was up.

Koko drove more quickly than Skye felt comfortable with, and the mudded pot holes caused the car to bump around heavily. Fifi whined in her carrier, and Skye felt the familiar and unwelcome taste of nausea fill her stomach. She had never been a good traveller. It was one of the things that had annoyed Ryan the most in all their years of marriage. He accused her of making journeys take twice the time, due to the amount she asked for him to stop the car so she could get some air.

As if Koko had been reading her mind, the car came to a sharp halt.
1111112.title: The short cut

11112.content:
Soon enough, they were in the air, flying quite smoothly for such a plane, (out of shape as it was), and nearing the island.

'The whole place seems to be deserted,' Skye thought, observing the overgrown, overrun-by-a-forest island.

"Where's the hotel?" she inquired, turning to Koko. Koko turned around, momentarily distracted by her question.

"What did you say?" he asked loudly, over the booming roar of the engine.

"I said, 'Where's the hotel'?" Syke repeated. No one was looking ahead.

"Oh," Koko said, finally turning back to the window. "It should be about-"

Suddenly there were several piercing cries, and thudding sounds that bounced the plane all over. Koko scrambled over to the back window. Several large cranes were flying away from the plane, but the rest had still not surpassed the aircraft. There was a creaking noise, more bird cries, the feeling of something being pulled away from the floor, and the lack of birds. They'd done their bit for Skye!

"Now what?" she asked Koko.

"I think they killed our engine," Koko winced. He looked out, and sure enough, it was falling for the water. "Get the old rafts out of the closet," he instructed her. "Blow one up."

"I can't!" she exclaimed. Suddenly she began to feel the plane go down. Skye squealed.

"Skye," a voice said- a man's, but not Koko's. It sounded so much like her husband had sounded! "You'll make it through this, I promise," he continued. Skye was in so much shock, she handed the raft to Koko!
11112.title: Crash landing

info.brief_description: Skye has lost everything because her cheating late husband died owing taxes.
info.description: Skye Phillips's husband dies and leaves her holding the bag for taxes owed. After having to sell everything she owns, the only thing she has left is a rundown hotel on a hawaiian island, which she has to have in good repair by tourist season, or live on the beach for the rest of her life and eat crabs! As if things were not bad enough, her late husbands ghost has shown up and won't leave her alone. Will she get the hotel running in time? Will she have to have a seance to rid the place of his ghost?
info.pretty_title: Pig roasts and late husband's ghost
